longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months from the arrival date. 
 - Passports issued to visitors born in Panama must be valid
   on arrival.
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 180 days for
nationals of Netherlands. 
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Netherlands will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds of
  at least USD 500.- per person to cover their stay (e.g. in
  the form of cash (USD only), traveller's cheques, major
  credit cards).
- Visitors are required to hold documents for their next
  destination. 
Warning:
- Visitors must hold return/onward tickets. (SEE NOTE 53772) 
    NOTE 53772: Exempt are those born in Panama, provided
   holding a National ID Card or a Birth Certificate issued by
   Panama
vaccination:
YELLOW FEVER VACCINATION NOT REQUIRED.

Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for passengers of 9 months
  of age and older travelling to all mainland areas east of
  the Canal Zone, (the entire comarcas of Embera and Kuna
  Yala, the province of Darien and areas of the provinces of
  Colon and Panama that are east of the Canal Zone.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax
  exists throughout the year in provinces and Comarcas along
  the Atlantic coast and the borders with Costa Rica and
  Colombia: Bocas del Toro, Chiriqui, Colon, Darien, Kuna
  Yala, Ngabe Bugle, Panama and Veraquas. In Panama City, the
  Canal Zone, and in the other provinces there is no or
  negligible risk of transmission. Recommended prevention in
  risk areas: B; areas bordering Colombia: C.
